intro: Wehlia thryptomenoides, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Wehlia thryptomenoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine.
